intro: Impatiens rivalis, commonly known as the pink impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid conditions. Impatiens rivalis is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation.
